instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V35_S3: What is PP1V35_S3? PP1V35_S3 is a 1.35v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: MAcbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC2909 no image, no CapsLocklight, only USB activity
threads.message:
Hi
MAcbookPro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A has no image/display, only once i got just backlight flash. CPU is getting very hot. No external display.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>-12.67V
Getting <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>- 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>- 5V
L7330, L7320, L7310 has 1.7V and 12 Ohm.
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>- 1.5V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>- 3.3V 
<SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3RS0_CPUDDR</SIGNAL>- 1.35V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>- 1.05V
<SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL>- 1.3V

Please suggest me what i am missing and where i have to look for the problem.

threads.title: MAcbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC2909 no image, no CapsLocklight, only USB activity
threads.message:
Any history available?
Do you have USB activity for sure?
Strange, if Caps Lock doesn't react.
External video present?

Check if <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high.

threads.title: MAcbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC2909 no image, no CapsLocklight, only USB activity
threads.message:
No previous repair history. New Board, no liquid damage.
I checked with external usb drive which has a blinking light. no external video present.
and <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> is also present high.

threads.title: MAcbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC2909 no image, no CapsLocklight, only USB activity
threads.message:
If has USB activity, but missing internal/external video at same time, then must be CPU problem; this board doesn't have dedictaed GPU.
Try known good BIOS, just in case.

threads.title: MAcbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC2909 no image, no CapsLocklight, only USB activity
threads.message: i don't have the known good bios. Can you please provide me a link. Thanks
